title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
Manufacturers are facing the highest steel and aluminum prices in years, another hurdle for U.S. companies already struggling to make a range of products.

DoorDash sued New York City over a law that would require food-delivery companies to share more data with restaurants.

U.S. stocks rebounded, with the S&P 500 and Nasdaq both advancing 0.8% and the Dow gaining 0.7%.

Growth across a range of Chinese economic indicators slowed sharply in August.

An ABC News staffer claimed the network retaliated against her after she alleged in a complaint that she was sexually assaulted by then-"GMA" producer Corn.

Microsoft's board approved a plan to buy back as much as $60 billion of the company's stock.

Robinhood kicked off a nationwide marketing campaign designed to turn more college students into customers of the trading app.

Goldman Sachs is acquiring specialty lender GreenSky for $2.2 billion.

What's News: Business & Finance
